etymology.description: Depicts a pictorial representation of a twisted rope, initially symbolizing 'self' or 'oneself'.
etymology.interpretation: The character 己(己) (jǐ, "self") represents a pictogram of a twisted rope, symbolizing the idea of turning back on oneself or introspection.

examples.chinese: 己所不欲(己所不欲)，勿施于人(勿施於人)。
examples.pinyin: jǐ suǒ bù yù, wù shī yú rén.
examples.english: Do not do unto others what you do not want done to yourself.

examples.chinese: 正视己的不足(正視己的不足)。
examples.pinyin: zhèng shì jǐ de bù zú.
examples.english: Confront and acknowledge your own shortcomings.

examples.chinese: 学会爱己(學會愛己)，才能更好地爱人(才能更好地愛人)。
examples.pinyin: xué huì ài jǐ, cái néng gèng hǎo de ài rén.
examples.english: Learn to love yourself in order to love others better.
